oai_dc:dc.dc:title: United Colonies $3.00
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutions; Colonies; Money
United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783; Military currency
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Continental Congress issued paper currency to finance the Revolutionary War. Continental currency was denominated in Spanish milled dollars. Eventually, the bills lost their value as they were too easily counterfeited. It became common to use the phrase, "not worth a Continental."
